intro: Eumachia carnea, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, red fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
